\par \noindent \color{red} O\color{black}ur father. Hail Mary. I confess. May almighty. May the almighty. O Lord thou. O God come. \color{red} Invita. \color{black} Come let us. \color{red} Invita. Hymn. Antiphon. \quad Psalm. \hypertarget{ps30}{30.} \color{black}
% \vspace{-.5em}
\lettrine[lines=2]{\bfseries \color{red} I}{n} thee, O Lord, have I hoped, let me never be confounded: deliver me in thy justice.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ow down thy ear to me: make haste to deliver me.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}e thou unto me a God, a protector, \& a house of refuge, to save me.
\newline \color{red} F\color{black}or thou art my strength \& my refuge; \& for thy name's sake thou wilt lead me, \& nourish me.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hou wilt bring me out of this snare, which they have hidden for me: for thou art my protector.
\newline \color{red} I\color{black}nto thy hands I commend my spirit: thou hast redeemed me, O Lord, the God of truth.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hou hast hated them that regard vanities, to no purpose.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ut I have hoped in the Lord: I will be glad \& rejoice in thy mercy.
\newline \color{red} F\color{black}or thou hast regarded my humility, thou hast saved my soul out of distresses.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd thou hast not shut me up in the hands of the enemy: thou hast set my feet in a spacious place.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}ave mercy on me, O Lord, for I am afflicted: my eye is troubled with wrath, my soul, \& my belly:
\newline \color{red} F\color{black}or my life is wasted with grief: \& my years in sighs.
\newline \color{red} M\color{black}y strength is weakened through poverty \& my bones are disturbed.
\newline \color{red} I\color{black}\ am become a reproach among all my enemies, \& very much to my neighbours; \& a fear to my acquaintance.
%pp78
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey that saw me without fled from me: I am forgotten as one dead from the heart.
\newline \color{red} I\color{black}\ am become as a vessel that is destroyed: for I have heard the blame of many that dwell round about.
\newline \color{red} W\color{black}hile they assembled together against me, they consulted to take away my life.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ut I have put my trust in thee, O Lord: I said: Thou art my God, my lots are in thy hands.
\newline \color{red} D\color{black}eliver me out of the hands of my enemies; \& from them that persecute me.
\newline \color{red} M\color{black}ake thy face to shine upon thy servant; save me in thy mercy: let me not be confounded, O Lord, for I have called upon thee.
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et the wicked be ashamed, \& be brought down to hell: let deceitful lips be made dumb.
\newline \color{red} W\color{black}hich speak iniquity against the just, with pride \& abuse.
\newline \color{red} O\color{black}\ how great is the multitude of thy sweetness, O Lord, which thou hast hidden for them that fear thee!
\newline \color{red} W\color{black}hich thou hast wrought for them that hope in thee, in the sight of the sons of men.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hou shalt hide them in the secret of thy face, from the disturbance of men.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hou shalt protect them in thy tabernacle from the contradiction of tongues.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}lessed be the Lord, for he hath shewn his wonderful mercy to me in a fortified city.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ut I said in the excess of my mind: I am cast away from before thy eyes.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}herefore thou hast heard the voice of my prayer, when I cried to thee.
\newline \color{red} O\color{black}\ love the Lord, all ye his saints: for the Lord will require truth, \& will repay them abundantly that act proudly.
\newline \color{red} D\color{black}o ye manfully, \& let your heart be strengthened, all ye that hope in the Lord. \quad \color{red} Psalm. \hypertarget{ps34}{34.} \color{black}
\vspace{-.5em}
\lettrine[lines=2]{\bfseries \color{red} J}{udge} thou, O Lord, them that wrong me: overthrow them that fight against me.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}ake hold of arms \& shield: \& rise up to help me.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ring out the sword, \& shut up the way against them that persecute me: say to my soul: I am thy salvation.
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et them be confounded \& ashamed that seek after my soul.
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et them be turned back \& be confounded that devise against me.
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et them become as dust before the wind: \& let the angel of the Lord straiten them.
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et their way become dark \& slippery; \& let the angel of the Lord pursue them.
\newline \color{red} F\color{black}or without cause they have hidden their net for me unto destruction: without cause they have upbraided my soul.
%pp79
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et the snare which he knoweth not come upon him: \& let the net which he hath hidden catch him: \& into that very snare let them fall.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ut my soul shall rejoice in the Lord; \& shall be delighted in his salvation.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}ll my bones shall say: Lord, who is like to thee?
\newline \color{red} W\color{black}ho deliverest the poor from the hand of them that are stronger than he; the needy \& the poor from them that strip him.
\newline \color{red} U\color{black}njust witnesses rising up have asked me things I knew not.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey repaid me evil for good: to the depriving me of my soul.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ut as for me, when they were troublesome to me, I was clothed with haircloth.
\newline \color{red} I\color{black}\ humbled my soul with fasting; \& my prayer shall be turned into my bosom.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}s a neighbour \& as an own brother, so did I please: as one mourning \& sorrowful so was I humbled.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ut they rejoiced against me, \& came together: scourges were gathered together upon me, \& I knew not.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey were separated, \& repented not: they tempted me, they scoffed at me with scorn: they gnashed upon me with their teeth.
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}ord, when wilt thou look upon me? rescue thou my soul from their malice: my only one from the lions.
\newline \color{red} I\color{black}\ will give thanks to thee in a great church; I will praise thee in a strong people.
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et not them that are my enemies wrongfully rejoice over me: who have hated me without cause, \& wink with the eyes.
\newline \color{red} F\color{black}or they spoke indeed peaceably to me; \& speaking in the anger of the earth they devised guile.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they opened their mouth wide against me; they said: Well done, well done, our eyes have seen it.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hou hast seen, O Lord, be not thou silent: O Lord, depart not from me.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}rise, \& be attentive to my judgment: to my cause, my God, \& my Lord.
\newline \color{red} J\color{black}udge me, O Lord my God according to thy justice, \& let them not rejoice over me.
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et them not say in their hearts: It is well, it is well, to our mind: neither let them say: We have swallowed him up.
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et them blush: \& be ashamed together, who rejoice at my evils.
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et them be clothed with confusion \& shame, who speak great things against me.
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et them rejoice \& be glad, who are well pleased with my justice, \& let them say always: The Lord be magnified, who delights in the peace of his servant.
%pp80
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd my tongue shall meditate thy justice, thy praise all the day long.
\newline \color{red} Psalm. \hypertarget{ps104}{104.} \color{black}
\vspace{-.5em}
\lettrine[lines=2]{\bfseries \color{red} G}{ive} glory to the Lord, \& call upon his name: declare his deeds among the Gentiles.
\newline \color{red} S\color{black}ing to him, yea sing praises to him: relate all his wondrous works.
\newline \color{red} G\color{black}lory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the Lord.
\newline \color{red} S\color{black}eek ye the Lord, \& be strengthened: seek his face evermore.
\newline \color{red} R\color{black}emember his marvellous works which he hath done; his wonders, \& the judgments of his mouth.
\newline \color{red} O\color{black}\ ye seed of Abraham his servant; ye sons of Jacob his chosen.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e is the Lord our God: his judgments are in all the earth.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e hath remembered his covenant for ever: the word which he commanded to a thousand generations.
\newline \color{red} W\color{black}hich he made to Abraham; \& his oath to Isaac:
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he appointed the same to Jacob for a law, \& to Israel for an everlasting testament:
\newline \color{red} S\color{black}aying: To thee will I give the land of Chanaan, the lot of your inheritance.
\newline \color{red} W\color{black}hen they were but a small number: yea very few, \& sojourners therein:
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they passed from nation to nation, \& from one kingdom to another people.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e suffered no man to hurt them: \& he reproved kings for their sakes.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}ouch ye not my anointed: \& do no evil to my prophets.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he called a famine upon the land: \& he broke in pieces all the support of bread.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e sent a man before them: Joseph, who was sold for a slave.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey humbled his feet in fetters: the iron pierced his soul, until his word came.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}he word of the Lord inflamed him: the king sent, \& he released him: the ruler of the people, \& he set him at liberty.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e made him master of his house, \& ruler of all his possession.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hat he might instruct his princes as himself, \& teach his ancients wisdom.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd Israel went into Egypt: \& Jacob was a sojourner in the land of Cham.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he increased his people exceedingly: \& strengthened them over their enemies,
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e turned their heart to hate his people: \& to deal deceitfully with his servants.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e sent Moses his servant: Aaron the man whom he had chosen.
%pp81
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e gave them power to shew his signs, \& his wonders in the land of Cham.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e sent darkness, \& made it obscure: \& grieved not his words.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e turned their waters into blood, \& destroyed their fish.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}heir land brought forth frogs, in the inner chambers of their kings.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e spoke, \& there came divers sorts of flies \& sciniphs in all their coasts.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e gave them hail for rain, a burning fire in the land.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he destroyed their vineyards \& their fig trees: \& he broke in pieces the trees of their coasts.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e spoke, \& the locust came, \& the bruchus, of which there was no number.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they devoured all the grass in their land, \& consumed all the fruit of their ground.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he slew all the firstborn in their land: the firstfruits of all their labour.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he brought them out with silver \& gold: \& there was not among their tribes one that was feeble.
\newline \color{red} E\color{black}gypt was glad when they departed: for the fear of them lay upon them.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e spread a cloud for their protection, \& fire to give them light in the night.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey asked, \& the quail came: \& he filled them with the bread of heaven.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e opened the rock, \& waters flowed: rivers ran down in the dry land.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ecause he remembered his holy word, which he had spoken to his servant Abraham.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he brought forth his people with joy, \& his chosen with gladness.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he gave them the lands of the Gentiles: \& they possessed the labours of the people:
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hat they might observe his justifications, \& seek after his law. \color{red} Antiphon. \color{black}

\newline \color{red} T\color{black}he Lord hath made known his salvation: he hath revealed his justice in the sight of the Gentiles.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e hath remembered his mercy \& his truth toward the house of Israel.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}ll the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.
\newline \color{red} S\color{black}ing joyfully to God, all the earth; make melody, rejoice \& sing.
\newline \color{red} S\color{black}ing praise to the Lord on the harp, on the harp, \& with the voice of a psalm: with long trumpets, \& sound of cornet.

\newline \color{red} T\color{black}he rivers shall clap their hands, the mountains shall rejoice together at the presence of the Lord: because he cometh to judge the earth.

\vspace{-1.25em}
\lettrine[lines=2]{\bfseries \color{red} B}{less} the Lord, O my soul: O Lord my God, thou art exceedingly great.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hou hast put on praise \& beauty: \& art clothed with light as with a garment.
\newline \color{red} W\color{black}ho stretchest out the heaven like a pavilion: who coverest the higher rooms thereof with water.
\newline \color{red} W\color{black}ho makest the clouds thy chariot: who walkest upon the wings of the winds.
\newline \color{red} W\color{black}ho makest thy angels spirits: \& thy ministers a burning fire.
\newline \color{red} W\color{black}ho hast founded the earth upon its own bases: it shall not be moved for ever \& ever.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}he deep like a garment is its clothing: above the mountains shall the waters stand.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}t thy rebuke they shall flee: at the voice of thy thunder they shall fear.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}he mountains ascend, \& the plains descend into the place which thou hast founded for them.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hou hast set a bound which they shall not pass over; neither shall they return to cover the earth.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hou sendest forth springs in the vales: between the midst of the hills the waters shall pass.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}ll the beasts of the field shall drink: the wild asses shall expect in their thirst.
\newline \color{red} O\color{black}ver them the birds of the air shall dwell: from the midst of the rocks they shall give forth their voices.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hou waterest the hills from thy upper rooms: the earth shall be filled with the fruit of thy works:
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ringing forth grass for cattle, \& herb for the service of men.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hat thou mayst bring bread out of the earth: \& that wine may cheer the heart of man.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hat he may make the face cheerful with oil: \& that bread may strengthen man's heart.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}he trees of the field shall be filled, \& the cedars of Libanus which he hath planted: there the sparrows shall make their nests.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}he highest of them is the house of the heron: the high hills are a refuge for the harts, the rock for the irchins.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e hath made the moon for seasons: the sun knoweth his going down.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hou hast appointed darkness, \& it is night: in it shall all the beasts of the woods go about:
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}he young lions roaring after their prey, \& seeking their meat from God.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}he sun ariseth, \& they are gathered together: \& they shall lie down in their dens.
\newline \color{red} M\color{black}an shall go forth to his work, \& to his labour until the evening.
%pp83
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}ow great are thy works, O Lord? thou hast made all things in wisdom: the earth is filled with thy riches.
\newline \color{red} S\color{black}o is this great sea, which stretcheth wide its arms: there are creeping things without number:
\newline \color{red} C\color{black}reatures little \& great: there the ships shall go.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}his sea dragon which thou hast formed to play therein: all expect of thee that thou give them food in season.
\newline \color{red} W\color{black}hat thou givest to them they shall gather up: when thou openest thy hand, they shall all be filled with good.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ut if thou turnest away thy face, they shall be troubled: thou shalt take away their breath, \& they shall fail, \& shall return to their dust.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hou shalt send forth thy spirit, \& they shall be created: \& thou shalt renew the face of the earth.
\newline \color{red} M\color{black}ay the glory of the Lord endure for ever: the Lord shall rejoice in his works.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e looketh upon the earth, \& maketh it tremble: he toucheth the mountains, \& they smoke.
\newline \color{red} I\color{black} will sing to the Lord as long as I live: I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et my speech be acceptable to him: but I will take delight in the Lord.
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et sinners be consumed out of the earth, \& the unjust, so that they be no more: O my soul, bless thou the Lord.

\lettrine[lines=2]{\bfseries \color{red} I}{}\ will\leftmarginnote{\begin{flushright}Isa.\\12.\end{flushright}} give thanks to thee, O Lord, for thou wast angry with me: thy wrath is turned away, \& thou hast comforted me.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ehold, God is my saviour, I will deal confidently, \& will not fear:
\newline \color{red} O\color{black}\ because the Lord is my strength, \& my praise, \& he is become my salvation.
\newline \color{red} Y\color{black}ou shall draw waters with joy out of the saviour's fountains: \& you shall say in that day: Praise ye the Lord, \& call upon his name:
\newline \color{red} M\color{black}ake his works known among the people: remember that his name is high.
\newline \color{red} S\color{black}ing ye to the Lord, for he hath done great things: shew this forth in all the earth.
\newline \color{red} R\color{black}ejoice, \& praise, O thou habitation of Sion: for great is he that is in the midst of thee, the Holy One of Israel.

\par \noindent \color{red} O\color{black}ur father. Hail Mary. O God come to my. \hyperlink{Iamlucis}{Now in the sun. 8.} \color{red} Antiphon. \color{black} Shew. \color{red} Psalm. \hypertarget{ps22}{22.} \color{black}
% \vspace{-.5em}
\lettrine[lines=5]{\zallmancaps T}{he} Lord ruleth me: \& I shall want nothing: He hath set me in a place of pasture.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e hath brought me up, on the water of refreshment: He hath converted my soul.
%pp84
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e hath led me on the paths of justice, for his own name's sake.
\newline \color{red} F\color{black}or though I should walk in the midst of the shadow of death, I will fear no evils, for thou art with me.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hy rod \& thy staff, they have comforted me.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hou hast prepared a table before me against them that afflict me.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hou hast anointed my head with oil; \& my chalice which inebriateth me, how goodly is it!
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd thy mercy will follow me all the days of my life.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd that I may dwell in the house of the Lord unto length of days.
\newline \color{red} Psalm. \hypertarget{ps23}{23.} \color{black}

%pp113
\newline \color{red} I\color{black}\ will open my mouth in parables: I will utter propositions from the beginning.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}ow great things have we heard \& known, \& our fathers have told us.

\newline \color{red} D\color{black}eclaring the praises of the Lord, \& his powers, \& his wonders which he hath done.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he set up a testimony in Jacob: \& made a law in Israel.

\newline \color{red} T\color{black}he children that should be born \& should rise up, \& declare them to their children.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hat they may put their hope in God \& may not forget the works of God: \& may seek his commandments.

\newline \color{red} A\color{black}\ generation that set not their heart aright: \& whose spirit was not faithful to God.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}he sons of Ephraim who bend \& shoot with the bow: they have turned back in the day of battle.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey kept not the covenant of God: \& in his law they would not walk.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they forgot his benefits, \& his wonders that he had shewn them.
\newline \color{red} W\color{black}onderful things did he do in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Tanis.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e divided the sea \& brought them through: \& he made the waters to stand as in a vessel.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he conducted them with a cloud by day: \& all the night with a light of fire.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e struck the rock in the wilderness: \& gave them to drink, as out of the great deep.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e brought forth water out of the rock: \& made streams run down as rivers.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they added yet more sin against him: they provoked the most High to wrath in the place without water.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they tempted God in their hearts, by asking meat for their desires.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they spoke ill of God: they said: Can God furnish a table in the wilderness?
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ecause he struck the rock, \& the waters gushed out, \& the streams overflowed.
\newline \color{red} C\color{black}an he also give bread, or provide a table for his people?
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}herefore the Lord heard, \& was angry: \& a fire was kindled against Jacob, \& wrath came up against Israel.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ecause they believed not in God: \& trusted not in his salvation.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he had commanded the clouds from above, \& had opened the doors of heaven.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd had rained down manna upon them to eat, \& had given them the bread of heaven.
%pp114
\newline \color{red} M\color{black}an ate the bread of angels: he sent them provisions in abundance.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e removed the south wind from heaven: \& by his power brought in the southwest wind.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he rained upon them flesh as dust: \& feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they fell in the midst of their camp, round about their pavilions.
\newline \color{red} S\color{black}o they did eat, \& were filled exceedingly, \& he gave them their desire:
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey were not defrauded of that which they craved. As yet their meat was in their mouth: \& the wrath of God came upon them.
\newline \color{red}  \color{black}he slew the fat ones amongst them, \& brought down the chosen men of Israel.
\newline \color{red} I\color{black}n all these things they sinned still: \& they believed not for his wondrous works.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd their days were consumed in vanity, \& their years in haste.
\newline \color{red} W\color{black}hen he slew them, then they sought him: \& they returned, \& came to him early in the morning.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they remembered that God was their helper: \& the most high God their redeemer.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they loved him with their mouth: \& with their tongue they lied unto him:
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ut their heart was not right with him: nor were they counted faithful in his covenant.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ut he is merciful, \& will forgive their sins: \& will not destroy them.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd many a time did he turn away his anger: \& did not kindle all his wrath.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he remembered that they are flesh: a wind that goeth \& returneth not.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}ow often did they provoke him in the desert: \& move him to wrath in the place without water?
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they turned back \& tempted God: \& grieved the holy one of Israel.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey remembered not his hand, in the day that he redeemed them from the hand of him that afflicted them:
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}ow he wrought his signs in Egypt, \& his wonders in the field of Tanis.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he turned their rivers into blood, \& their showers that they might not drink.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e sent amongst them divers sores of flies, which devoured them: \& frogs which destroyed them.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he gave up their fruits to the blast, \& their labours to the locust.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he destroyed their vineyards with hail, \& their mulberry trees with hoarfrost.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he gave up their cattle to the hail, \& their stock to the fire.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he sent upon them the wrath of his indignation: indignation \& wrath \& trouble, which he sent by evil angels.
%pp115
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e made a way for a path to his anger: he spared not their souls from death, \& their cattle he shut up in death.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he killed all the firstborn in the land of Egypt: the firstfruits of all their labour in the tabernacles of Cham.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he took away his own people as sheep: \& guided them in the wilderness like a flock.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he brought them out in hope, \& they feared not: \& the sea overwhelmed their enemies.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he brought them into the mountain of his sanctuary: the mountain which his right hand had purchased.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he cast out the Gentiles before them: \& by lot divided to them their land by a line of distribution.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tabernacles.
\newline \color{red} Y\color{black}et they tempted, \& provoked the most high God: \& they kept not his testimonies.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they turned away, \& kept not the covenant: even like their fathers they were turned aside as a crooked bow.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey provoked him to anger on their hills: \& moved him to jealousy with their graven things.
\newline \color{red} G\color{black}od heard, \& despised them, \& he reduced Israel exceedingly as it were to nothing.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he put away the tabernacle of Silo, his tabernacle where he dwelt among men.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he delivered their strength into captivity: \& their beauty into the hands of the enemy.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he shut up his people under the sword: \& he despised his inheritance.
\newline \color{red} F\color{black}ire consumed their young men: \& their maidens were not lamented.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}heir priests fell by the sword: \& their widows did not mourn.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd the Lord was awaked as one out of sleep, \& like a mighty man that hath been surfeited with wine.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he smote his enemies on the hinder parts: he put them to an everlasting reproach.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he rejected the tabernacle of Joseph: \& chose not the tribe of Ephraim:
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ut he chose the tribe of Juda, mount Sion which he loved.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he built his sanctuary as of unicorns, in the land which he founded for ever.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he chose his servant David, \& took him from the flocks of sheep: he brought him from following the ewes great with young,
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}o feed Jacob his servant, \& Israel his inheritance.
%pp116
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he fed them in the innocence of his heart: \& conducted them by the skillfulness of his hands. \quad \color{red} Antiphon. \color{black}

\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ut my mercy I will not take away from him: nor will I suffer my truth to fail.
\newline \color{red} N\color{black}either will I profane my covenant: \& the words that proceed from my mouth I will not make void.

\newline \color{red} B\color{black}e mindful, O Lord, of the reproach of thy servants (which I have held in my bosom) of many nations:

\newline \color{red} M\color{black}y heart is troubled within me: \& the fear of death is fallen upon me.
\newline \color{red} F\color{black}ear \& trembling are come upon me: \& darkness hath covered me.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd I said: Who will give me wings like a dove, \& I will fly \& be at rest?
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}o, I have gone far off flying away; \& I abode in the wilderness.
\newline \color{red} I\color{black}\ waited for him that hath saved me from pusillanimity of spirit, \& a storm.
\newline \color{red} C\color{black}ast down, O Lord, \& divide their tongues; for I have seen iniquity \&contradiction in the city.
\newline \color{red} D\color{black}ay \& night shall iniquity surround it upon its walls: \& in the midst thereof are labour, \& injustice.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd usury \& deceit have not departed from its streets.
\newline \color{red} F\color{black}or if my enemy had reviled me, I would verily have borne with it.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd if he that hated me had spoken great things against me, I would perhaps have hidden myself from him.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ut thou a man of one mind, my guide, \& my familiar,
\newline \color{red} W\color{black}ho didst take sweetmeats together with me: in the house of God we walked with consent.
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et death come upon them, \& let them go down alive into hell.
\newline \color{red} F\color{black}or there is wickedness in their dwellings: in the midst of them.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ut I have cried to God: \& the Lord will save me.
\newline \color{red} E\color{black}vening \& morning, \& at noon I will speak \& declare: \& he shall hear my voice.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e shall redeem my soul in peace from them that draw near to me: for among many they were with me.
\newline \color{red} G\color{black}od shall hear, \& the Eternal shall humble them.
\newline \color{red} F\color{black}or there is no change with them, \& they have not feared God: He hath stretched forth his hand to repay.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey have defiled his covenant, they are divided by the wrath of his countenance, \& his heart hath drawn near.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}is words are smoother than oil, \& the same are darts.
\newline \color{red} C\color{black}ast thy care upon the Lord, \& he shall sustain thee: he shall not suffer the just to waver for ever.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ut thou, O God, shalt bring them down into the pit of destruction.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}loody \& deceitful men shall not live out half their days; but I will trust in thee, O Lord. \quad \color{red} Psalm. \hypertarget{ps105}{105.} \color{black}
\vspace{-.5em}
\lettrine[lines=2]{\bfseries \color{red} G}{ive} glory to the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.
\newline \color{red} W\color{black}ho shall declare the powers of the Lord? who shall set forth all his praises?
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}lessed are they that keep judgment, \& do justice at all times.
%pp164
\newline \color{red} R\color{black}emember us, O Lord, in the favour of thy people: visit us with thy salvation.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hat we may see the good of thy chosen, that we may rejoice in the joy of thy nation: that thou mayst be praised with thy inheritance.
\newline \color{red} W\color{black}e have sinned with our fathers: we have acted unjustly, we have wrought iniquity.
\newline \color{red} O\color{black}ur fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt: they remembered not the multitude of thy mercies:
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they provoked to wrath going up to the sea, even the Red Sea.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he saved them for his own name's sake: that he might make his power known.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he rebuked the Red Sea, \& it was dried up: \& he led them through the depths, as in a wilderness.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he saved them from the hand of them that hated them: \& he redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd the water covered them that afflicted them: there was not one of them left.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they believed his words: \& they sang his praises.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey had quickly done, they forgot his works: \& they waited not for his counsels.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they coveted their desire in the desert: \& they tempted God in the place without water.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he gave them their request: \& sent fulness into their souls.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they provoked Moses in the camp, Aaron the holy one of the Lord.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}he earth opened \& swallowed up Dathan: \& covered the congregation of Abiron.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd a fire was kindled in their congregation: the flame burned the wicked.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey made also a calf in Horeb: \& they adored the graven thing.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they changed their glory into the likeness of a calf that eateth grass.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey forgot God, who saved them, who had done great things in Egypt, wondrous works in the land of Cham: terrible things in the Red Sea.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he said that he would destroy them: had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach:
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}o turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy them. And they set at nought the desirable land.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey believed not his word, \& they murmured in their tents: they hearkened not to the voice of the Lord.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he lifted up his hand over them: to overthrow them in the desert;
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd to cast down their seed among the nations, \& to scatter them in the countries.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey also were initiated to Beelphegor: \& ate the sacrifices of the dead.
%pp165
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they provoked him with their inventions: \& destruction was multiplied among them.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hen Phinees stood up, \& pacified him: \& the slaughter ceased.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd it was reputed to him unto justice, to generation \& generation for evermore.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey provoked him also at the waters of contradiction:
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd Moses was afflicted for their sakes: because they exasperated his spirit.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he distinguished with his lips. They did not destroy the nations of which the Lord spoke unto them.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they were mingled among the heathens, \& learned their works: \& served their idols, \& it became a stumblingblock to them.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they sacrificed their sons, \& their daughters to devils.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they shed innocent blood: the blood of their sons \& of their daughters which they sacrificed to the idols of Chanaan.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd the land was polluted with blood, \& was defiled with their works: \& they went aside after their own inventions.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd the Lord was exceedingly angry with his people: \& he abhorred his inheritance.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he delivered them into the hands of the nations: \& they that hated them had dominion over them.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd their enemies afflicted them: \& they were humbled under their hands: many times did he deliver them.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ut they provoked him with their counsel: \& they were brought low by their iniquities.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he saw when they were in tribulation: \& he heard their prayer.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he was mindful of his covenant: \& repented according to the multitude of his mercies.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he gave them unto mercies, in the sight of all those that had made them captives.
\newline \color{red} S\color{black}ave us, O Lord, our God: \& gather us from among nations:
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hat we may give thanks to thy holy name, \& may glory in thy praise.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}lessed be the Lord the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting: \& let all the people say: So be it, so be it.
\newline \color{red} Psalm. \hypertarget{ps106}{106.} \color{black}
\vspace{-.5em}
\lettrine[lines=2]{\bfseries \color{red} G}{ive} glory to the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et them say so that have been redeemed by the Lord, whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the enemy: \& gathered out of the countries.
\newline \color{red} F\color{black}rom the rising \& the setting of the sun, from the north \& from the sea.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey wandered in a wilderness, in a place without water: they found not the way of a city for their habitation.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey were hungry \& thirsty: their soul fainted in them.
%pp166
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they cried to the Lord in their tribulation: \& he delivered them out of their distresses.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he led them into the right way: that they might go to a city of habitation.
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et the mercies of the Lord give glory to him: \& his wonderful works to the children of men.
\newline \color{red} F\color{black}or he hath satisfied the empty soul, \& hath filled the hungry soul with good things.
\newline \color{red} S\color{black}uch as sat in darkness \& in the shadow of death: bound in want \& in iron.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ecause they had exasperated the words of God: \& provoked the counsel of the most High:
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd their heart was humbled with labours: they were weakened, \& there was none to help them.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hen they cried to the Lord in their affliction: \& he delivered them out of their distresses.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he brought them out of darkness, \& the shadow of death; \& broke their bonds in sunder.
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et the mercies of the Lord give glory to him, \& his wonderful works to the children of men.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ecause he hath broken gates of brass, \& burst the iron bars.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e took them out of the way of their iniquity: for they were brought low for their injustices.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}heir soul abhorred all manner of meat: \& they drew nigh even to the gates of death.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they cried to the Lord in their affliction: \& he delivered them out of their distresses.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e sent his word, \& healed them: \& delivered them from their destructions.
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et the mercies of the Lord give glory to him: \& his wonderful works to the children of men.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd let them sacrifice the sacrifice of praise: \& declare his works with joy.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey that go down to the sea in ships, doing business in the great waters:
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hese have seen the works of the Lord, \& his wonders in the deep.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e said the word, \& there arose a storm of wind: \& the waves thereof were lifted up.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey mount up to the heavens, \& they go down to the depths: their soul pined away with evils.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey were troubled, \& reeled like a drunken man; \& all their wisdom was swallowed up.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they cried to the Lord in their affliction: \& he brought them out of their distresses.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he turned the storm into a breeze: \& its waves were still.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they rejoiced because they were still: \& he brought them to the haven which they wished for.
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et the mercies of the Lord give glory to him, \& his wonderful works to the children of men.
%pp167
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd let them exalt him in the church of the people: \& praise him in the chair of the ancients.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e hath turned rivers into a wilderness: \& the sources of water into dry ground:
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}\ fruitful land into barrenness, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e hath turned a wilderness into pools of water, \& a dry land into water springs.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd hath placed there the hungry; \& they made a city for their habitation.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd they sowed fields, \& planted vineyards: \& they yielded fruit of birth.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he blessed them, \& they were multiplied exceedingly: \& their cattle he suffered not to decrease.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hen they were brought to be few: \& they were afflicted through the trouble of evils \& sorrow.
\newline \color{red} C\color{black}ontempt was poured forth upon their princes: \& he caused them to wander where there was no passing, \& out of the way.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he helped the poor out of poverty: \& made him families like a flock of sheep.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}he just shall see, \& shall rejoice, \& all iniquity shall stop their mouth.
\newline \color{red} W\color{black}ho is wise, \& will keep these things: \& will understand the mercies of the Lord?

\par \noindent O God come. \color{red} An. Psalm. \hypertarget{ps116}{116.} \color{black}
\lettrine[lines=5]{\zallmancaps O}{}\ praise the Lord, all ye nations: praise him, all ye people.
\newline \color{red} F\color{black}or his mercy is confirmed upon us: \& the truth of the Lord remaineth for ever. \quad \color{red} Psalm. \hypertarget{ps150}{150.} \color{black}
% \vspace{-.5em}
\lettrine[lines=2]{\bfseries \color{red} P}{raise} ye the Lord in his holy places: praise ye him in the firmament of his power.
\newline \color{red} P\color{black}raise ye him for his mighty acts: praise ye him according to the multitude of his greatness.
\newline \color{red} P\color{black}raise him with sound of trumpet: praise him with psaltery \& harp.
\newline \color{red} P\color{black}raise him with timbrel \& choir: praise him with strings \& organs.
\newline \color{red} P\color{black}raise him on high sounding cymbals: praise him on cymbals of joy: let every spirit praise the Lord.
\vspace{-1em}
\begin{center} \color{red}
\hypertarget{Auditecoeli}{Canticle} of Moses.
\end{center}
\vspace{-1em}
\lettrine[lines=2]{\bfseries \color{red} H}{ear}, O ye heavens, the things I speak, let the earth give ear to the words of my mouth.
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et my doctrine gather as the rain, let my speech distil as the dew,
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}s a shower upon the herb, \& as drops upon the grass. Because I will invoke the name of the Lord:
\newline \color{red} G\color{black}ive ye magnificence to our God. The works of God are perfect, \& all his ways are judgments:
%pp168
\newline \color{red} G\color{black}od is faithful \& without any iniquity, he is just \& right. They have sinned against him, \& are not of his children in their filth:
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey are a wicked \& perverse generation. Is this the return thou makest to the Lord, O foolish \& senseless people?
\newline \color{red} I\color{black}s not he thy father, that hath possessed thee, \& made thee, \& created thee?
\newline \color{red} R\color{black}emember the days of old, think upon every generation:
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}sk thy father, \& he will declare to thee: thy elders \& they will tell thee.
\newline \color{red} W\color{black}hen the Most High divided the nations: when he separated the sons of Adam,
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e appointed the bounds of people according to the number of the children of Israel.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ut the Lord's portion is his people: Jacob the lot of his inheritance.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e found him in a desert land, in a place of horror, \& of vast wilderness:
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e led him about, \& taught him: \& he kept him as the apple of his eye.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}s the eagle enticing her young to fly, \& hovering over them,
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e spread his wings, \& hath taken him \& carried him on his shoulders.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}he Lord alone was his leader: \& there was no strange god with him.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e set him upon high land: that he might eat the fruits of the fields,
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hat he might suck honey out of the rock, \& oil out of the hardest stone,
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}utter of the herd, \& milk of the sheep with the fat of lambs, \& of the rams of the breed of Basan:
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd goats with the marrow of wheat, \& might drink the purest blood of the grape.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}he beloved grew fat, \& kicked: he grew fat, \& thick \& gross,
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e forsook God who made him, \& departed from God his saviour.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey provoked him by strange gods, \& stirred him up to anger, with their abominations.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey sacrificed to devils \& not to God: to gods whom they knew not:
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hat were newly come up, whom their fathers worshipped not.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hou hast forsaken the God that beget thee, \& hast forgotten the Lord that created thee.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}he Lord saw, \& was moved to wrath: because his own sons \& daughters provoked him.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he said: I will hide my face from them, \& will consider what their last end shall be:
\newline \color{red} F\color{black}or it is a perverse generation, \& unfaithful children.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey have provoked me with that which was no god, \& have angered me with their vanities:
%pp169
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd I will provoke them with that which is no people, \& will vex them with a foolish nation.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}\ fire is kindled in my wrath, \& shall burn even to the lowest hell:
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd shall devour the earth with her increase, \& shall burn the foundations of the mountains.
\newline \color{red} I\color{black}\ will heap evils upon them, \& will spend my arrows among them.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey shall be consumed with famine, \& birds shall devour them with a most bitter bite:
\newline \color{red} I\color{black}\ will send the teeth of beasts upon them, with the fury of creatures that trail upon the ground, \& of serpents.
\newline \color{red} W\color{black}ithout, the sword shall lay them waste, \& terror within, both the young man \& the virgin, the sucking child with the man in years.
\newline \color{red} I\color{black}\ said: Where are they? I will make the memory of them to cease from among men.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ut for the wrath of the enemies I have deferred it: lest perhaps their enemies might be proud,
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd should say: Our mighty hand, \& not the Lord, hath done all these things.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hey are a nation without counsel, \& without wisdom. O that they would be wise \& would understand, \& would provide for their last end.
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}ow should one pursue after a thousand, \& two chase ten thousand?
\newline \color{red} W\color{black}as it not, because their God had sold them, \& the Lord had shut them up?
\newline \color{red} F\color{black}or our God is not as their gods: our enemies themselves are judges.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}heir vines are of the vineyard of Sodom, \& of the suburbs of Gomorrha:
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}heir grapes are grapes of gall, \& their clusters most bitter.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}heir wine is the gall of dragons, \& the venom of asps, which is incurable.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}re not these things stored up with me, \& sealed up in my treasures?
\newline \color{red} R\color{black}evenge is mine, \& I will repay them in due time, that their foot may slide:
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}he day of destruction is at hand, \& the time makes haste to come.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}he Lord will judge his people, \& will have mercy on his servants:
\newline \color{red} H\color{black}e shall see that their hand is weakened, \& that they who were shut up have also failed, \& they that remained are consumed.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd he shall say: Where are their gods, in whom they trusted?
\newline \color{red} O\color{black}f whose victims they ate the fat, \& drank the wine of their drink offerings:
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et them arise \& help you, \& protect you in your distress.
\newline \color{red} S\color{black}ee ye that I alone am, \& there is no other God besides me:
\newline \color{red} I\color{black}\ will kill \& I will make to live: I will strike, \& I will heal, \& there is none that can deliver out of my hand.
\newline \color{red} I\color{black}\ will lift up my hand to heaven, \& I will say: I live for ever.
%pp170
\newline \color{red} I\color{black}f I shall whet my sword as the lightning, \& my hand take hold on judgment:
\newline \color{red} I\color{black}\ will render vengeance to my enemies, \& repay them that hate me.
\newline \color{red} I\color{black}\ will make my arrows drunk with blood, \& my sword shall devour flesh,
\newline \color{red} O\color{black}f the blood of the slain \& of the captivity, of the bare head of the enemies.
\newline \color{red} P\color{black}raise his people, ye nations, for he will revenge the blood of his servants:
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd will render vengeance to their enemies, \& he will be merciful to the land of his people.
\newline \color{red} Then. \color{black} \hyperlink{Benedictus}{Blessed. pg. 7.} \color{red} Antiphon. Prayer. Commemoration. \color{black}

AT PRIME.

\par \noindent \color{red} O\color{black} ur father. Hail Mary. O God come to. \hyperlink{Iamlucis}{Now in the. 8.} \color{red} Antiphon. \color{black} O God. \color{red} Psalm. \hypertarget{ps62}{62.} \color{black}
% \vspace{-.5em}
\lettrine[lines=5]{\zallmancaps O}{}\ God, my God, to thee do I watch at break of day.
\newline \color{red} F\color{black}or thee my soul hath thirsted; for thee my flesh, O how many ways!
\newline \color{red} I\color{black}n a desert land, \& where there is no way, \& no water: so in the sanctuary have I come before thee, to see thy power \& thy glory.
\newline \color{red} F\color{black}or thy mercy is better than lives: thee my lips shall praise.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hus will I bless thee all my life long: \& in thy name I will lift up my hands.
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et my soul be filled as with marrow \& fatness: \& my mouth shall praise thee with joyful lips.
\newline \color{red} I\color{black}f I have remembered thee upon my bed, I will meditate on thee in the morning: because thou hast been my helper.
\newline \color{red} A\color{black}nd I will rejoice under the covert of thy wings: my soul hath stuck close to thee: thy right hand hath received me.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ut they have sought my soul in vain, they shall go into the lower parts of the earth: they shall be delivered into the hands of the sword, they shall be the portions of foxes.
\newline \color{red} B\color{black}ut the king shall rejoice in God, all they shall be praised that swear by him: because the mouth is stopped of them that speak wicked things. \color{red} Psalm. \hypertarget{ps66}{66.} \color{black}
\vspace{-.25em}
\lettrine[lines=2]{\bfseries \color{red} M}{ay} God have mercy on us, \& bless us: may he cause the light of his countenance to shine upon us, \& may he have mercy on us.
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}hat we may know thy way upon earth: thy salvation in all nations.
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et people confess to thee, O God: let all people give praise to thee.
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et the nations be glad \& rejoice: for thou judgest the people with justice, \& directest the nations upon earth.
\newline \color{red} L\color{black}et the people, O God, confess to thee: let all the people give praise to thee: the earth hath yielded her fruit.

\lettrine[lines=5]{\zallmancaps T}{he} vision\rightmarginnote{cha. 1.} of Isaias the son of Amos, which he saw concerning Juda \& Jerusalem in the days of Ozias, Joathan, Achaz, \& Ezechias, kings of Juda. Hear, O ye heavens, \& give ear, O earth, for the Lord hath spoken. I have brought up children, \& exalted them: but they have despised me. The ox knoweth his owner, \& the ass his master's crib: but Israel hath not known me, \& my people hath not understood. Woe to the sinful nation, a people laden with iniquity, a wicked seed, ungracious children: they have forsaken the Lord, they have blasphemed the Holy One of Israel, they are gone away backwards. For what shall I strike you any more, you that increase transgression? the whole head is sick, \& the whole heart is sad.
From the sole of the foot unto the top of the head, there is no soundness therein: wounds \& bruises \& swelling sores: they are not bound up, nor dressed, nor fomented with oil. Your land is desolate, your cities are burnt with fire: your country strangers devour before your face, \& it shall be desolate as when wasted by enemies. And the daughter of Sion shall be left as a covert in a vineyard, \& as a lodge in a garden of cucumbers, \& as a city that is laid waste. Except the Lord of hosts had left us seed, we had been as Sodom, \& we should have been like to Gomorrha. Hear the word of the Lord, ye rulers of Sodom, give ear to the law of our God, ye people of Gomorrha.
To what purpose do you offer me the multitude of your victims, saith the Lord? I am full, I desire not holocausts of rams, \& fat of fatlings, \& blood of calves, \& lambs, \& buck goats. When you came to appear before me, who required these things at your hands, that you should walk in my courts? Offer sacrifice no more in vain: incense is an abomination to me. The new moons, \& the sabbaths, \& other festivals I will not abide, your assemblies are wicked.
%pp185
My soul hateth your new moons, \& your solemnities: they are become troublesome to me, I am weary of bearing them. And when you stretch forth your hands, I will turn away my eyes from you: \& when you multiply prayer, I will not hear: for your hands are full of blood.
\newline But thou, O Lord, have mercy upon us. \color{red} \Rbar . \color{black} Thanks be to God.

\lettrine[lines=2]{\bfseries \color{red} F}{orasmuch} as many have taken in hand to set forth in order a narration of the things that have been accomplished among us; According as they have delivered them unto us, who from the beginning were eyewitnesses \& ministers of the word: It seemed good to me also, having diligently attained to all things from the beginning, to write to thee in order, most excellent Theophilus, That thou mayest know the verity of those words in which thou hast been instructed.  \textdagger \ 
There\leftmarginnote{\begin{flushright}cha. 1.\\A\end{flushright}} was in the days of Herod, the king of Judea, a certain priest named Zachary, of the course of Abia; \& his wife was of the daughters of Aaron, \& her name Elizabeth.
And they were both just before God, walking in all the commandments \& justifications of the Lord without blame. And they had no son, for that Elizabeth was barren, \& they both were well advanced in years. And it came to pass, when he executed the priestly function in the order of his course before God, According to the custom of the priestly office, it was his lot to offer incense, going into the temple of the Lord. And all the multitude of the people was praying without, at the hour of incense.
And there appeared to him an angel of the Lord, standing on the right side of the altar of incense. And Zachary seeing him, was troubled, \& fear fell upon him. But the angel said to him: Fear not, Zachary, for thy prayer is heard; \& thy wife Elizabeth shall bear thee a son, \& thou shalt call his name John: And thou shalt have joy \& gladness, \& many shall rejoice in his nativity. For he shall be great before the Lord; \& shall drink no wine nor strong drink: \& he shall be filled with the Holy Ghost, even from his mother's womb.
%pp186
And he shall convert many of the children of Israel to the Lord their God. And he shall go before him in the spirit \& power of Elias; that he may turn the hearts of the fathers unto the children, \& the incredulous to the wisdom of the just, to prepare unto the Lord a perfect people.]
And\rightmarginnote{B} Zachary said to the angel: Whereby shall I know this? for I am an old man, \& my wife is advanced in years. And the angel answering, said to him: I am Gabriel, who stand before God: \& am sent to speak to thee, \& to bring thee these good tidings. And behold, thou shalt be dumb, \& shalt not be able to speak until the day wherein these things shall come to pass, because thou hast not believed my words, which shall be fulfilled in their time.
And the people were waiting for Zachary; \& they wondered that he tarried so long in the temple. And when he came out, he could not speak to them: \& they understood that he had seen a vision in the temple. And he made signs to them, \& remained dumb. And it came to pass, after the days of his office were accomplished, he departed to his own house. And after those days, Elizabeth his wife conceived, \& hid herself five months, saying: Thus hath the Lord dealt with me in the days wherein he hath had regard to take away my reproach among men.
\newline But thou, O Lord, \color{red} \&c. as above. \color{black}

%21:25
\lettrine[lines=2]{\bfseries \color{red} I}{}N\leftmarginnote{\begin{flushright}Lu.\\21.\end{flushright}} that time, Jesus said to his disciples, There shall be signs in the sun, \& in the moon, \& in the stars; \& upon the earth distress of nations. \color{red} And so on. \color{black}
% HOMILIA I. Habita ad populum in basilica sancti Petri apostoli, Dominica secunda Adventus Domini.
\newline \color{red} Homily by Pope Saint Gregory. \color{black}
\newline \color{red} T\color{black}he lesson of the Holy Gospel, which your fraternity has just heard, was preceded by the Lord saying a little earlier:
Nation shall rise against nation, \& kingdom against kingdom. And there shall be great earthquakes in divers places, \& pestilences, \& famines.
And after inserting certain intervening words, He added what you have just now heard:
There shall be signs in the sun, \& in the moon, \& in the stars; \& upon the earth distress of nations, by reason of the confusion of the roaring of the sea \& of the waves.
Of these things, indeed, we see that some have already occurred, while others we fear are about to come soon.
For we observe more in our tribulations that nations are rising against nations, \& their distress weighing upon the earth, than we read about in the books.
As for earthquakes toppling countless cities, you have frequently heard how often this has been reported from other parts of the world.
We are enduring pestilence without cessation.
%pp187
However, we have not yet openly seen signs in the sun, moon, \& stars.
But since these are also not far off, we deduce their approach from the very changes already occurring in the atmosphere.
For instance, before Italy was handed over to be struck by the sword of the pagans, we saw fiery formations in the sky, which later foreshadowed the spilling of human blood, shining as lightning.
As for the confusion of the sea \& its waves, that has not yet arisen as something new.
But since many things foretold have already been fulfilled, there is no doubt that the few remaining things will also follow.
For the certainty of future events is established by the fulfillment of those that have already occurred.
These things, dearest brothers, we say to you so that your minds may be awakened to the pursuit of vigilance:
that they may not grow sluggish through complacency, nor weakened by ignorance, but that they may always be stirred by fear \& strengthened in good works through careful attention.
Let us reflect on what our Redeemer added in His words:
Men will faint with fear \& with expectation of what is coming upon the whole world.
For the powers of the heavens will be shaken.
But thou, \&c.

\lettrine[lines=2]{\bfseries \color{red} S}{tir} up, O Lord, we pray thee, thy strength, \& come among us, that whereas through our sins \& wickedness we do justly apprehend thy wrathful judgments hanging over us, thy bountiful grace \& mercy may speedily help \& deliver us: Who livest \& reignest with God the Father in the unity of the Holy Spirit, God, world without end. \color{red} \Rbar . \color{black} Amen.
\newline \color{red} This prayer is said throughout this entire week when the office is for a feria. And whenever the office is celebrated for a feria to which no proper prayer is assigned, the prayer of the preceding Sunday is said. It should be noted that, once the prayer of the day is concluded, the following commemorations are made for the Blessed Virgin \& for all the saints in the manner described below. The antiphon Advent. \color{black} The Holy Ghost shall come upon thee, O Mary; fear not, thou shalt bear in thy womb the Son of God,

Haleluiah. \color{red} \Vbar . \color{black} Pray for us, O Holy Mother of God. \color{red} \Rbar . \color{black} That we may be made worthy of the promises of Christ. \color{red} L\color{black} et us pray. \color{red} Prayer. \color{black}
\vspace{-.5em}
\lettrine[lines=2]{\bfseries \color{red} O}{}\ God, who didst will that, at the announcement of an Angel, thy Word should take flesh in the womb of the Blessed Virgin Mary, grant to us thy suppliants, that we who believe her to be truly the Mother of God may be helped by her intercession with thee, Through the same Christ Our Lord. \color{red} \Rbar . \color{black} Amen.
\newline \color{red} Then the antiphon for the saints. \color{black} Behold, the Lord will come, \& all His Saints with Him: \& on that day there will be great light, Haleluiah. \color{red} \Vbar . \color{black} Behold, the Lord will appear upon a white cloud. \color{red} And with Him thousands of Saints. \color{black} Let us pray. \color{red} Prayer. \color{black}
\vspace{-.5em}
\lettrine[lines=2]{\bfseries \color{red} W}{e} beseech You, O Lord, cleanse our consciences by Your visitation, so that when Jesus Christ, Your Son, our Lord, comes with all His Saints, He may find within us a dwelling place prepared for Himself, Who with thee liveth \& reigneth, in the unity of the Holy Spirit, God, world without end. \color{red} \Rbar . \color{black} Amen.
\newline \color{red} Then say \Vbar . \color{black} Let us bless the Lord. \color{red} \Rbar. \color{black} Thanks be to God. \color{red} \Vbar . \color{black} May the souls of the faithful, through the mercy of God, rest in peace. \color{red} \Rbar . \color{black} Amen.

We take refuge under thy protection, O holy Mother of God! Through the same Christ Our Lord. \color{red} \Rbar . \color{black} Amen.
\newline \color{red} Antiphon of the Apostles, \& all the saints. \color{black} All ye saints of God, vouchsafe to plead for our salvation \& for that of all mankind. \color{red} \Vbar . \color{black} Be glad in the Lord, \& rejoice, ye just. \color{red} \Rbar . \color{black} \& glory, all ye right of heart. \color{red} L\color{black} et us pray. \color{red} Prayer. \color{black}

\lettrine[lines=5]{\zallmancaps W}{\textdagger}ash\leftmarginnote{\begin{flushright}cha. 1.\\E\end{flushright}} yourselves, be clean, take away the evil of your devices from my eyes: cease to do perversely, Learn to do well: seek judgment, relieve the oppressed, judge for the fatherless, defend the widow. And then come, \& accuse me, saith the Lord: if your sins be as scarlet, they shall be made as white as snow: \& if they be red as crimson, they shall be white as wool. If you be willing, \& will hearken to me, you shall eat the good things of the land.
But if you will not, \& will provoke me to wrath: the sword shall devour you because the mouth of the Lord hath spoken it.]
How\leftmarginnote{\begin{flushright}F\end{flushright}} is the faithful city, that was full of judgment, become a harlot? justice dwelt in it, but now murderers. Thy silver is turned into dross: thy wine is mingled with water. Thy princes are faithless, companions of thieves: they all love bribes, they run after rewards. They judge not for the fatherless: \& the widow's cause cometh not in to them. Therefore saith the Lord the God of hosts, the mighty one of Israel: Ah! I will comfort myself over my adversaries: \& I will be revenged of my enemies. And I will turn my hand to thee, \& I will clean purge away thy dross, \& I will take away all thy tin.
And I will restore thy judges as they were before, \& thy counsellors as of old. After this thou shalt be called the city of the just, a faithful city. Sion shall be redeemed in judgment, \& they shall bring her back in justice. And he shall destroy the wicked, \& the sinners together: \& they that have forsaken the Lord, shall be consumed. For they shall be confounded for the idols, to which they have sacrificed: \& you shall be ashamed of the gardens which you have chosen. When you shall be as an oak with the leaves falling off, \& as a garden without water.
And your strength shall be as the ashes of tow, \& your work as a spark: \& both shall burn together, \& there shall be none to quench it.

\vspace{-.25em}
%1:26-56
\lettrine[lines=2]{\bfseries \color{red} I}{n}\rightmarginnote{cha. 1.\\C} the sixth month \textdagger, the angel Gabriel was sent from God into a city of Galilee, called Nazareth, To a virgin espoused to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David; \& the virgin's name was Mary. And the angel being come in, said unto her: Hail, full of grace, the Lord is with thee: blessed art thou among women. Who having heard,
%pp196
was troubled at his saying, \& thought with herself what manner of salutation this should be. And the angel said to her: Fear not, Mary, for thou hast found grace with God.
Behold thou shalt conceive in thy womb, \& shalt bring forth a son; \& thou shalt call his name Jesus. He shall be great, \& shall be called the Son of the most High; \& the Lord God shall give unto him the throne of David his father; \& he shall reign in the house of Jacob for ever. And of his kingdom there shall be no end. And Mary said to the angel: How shall this be done, because I know not man? And the angel answering, said to her: The Holy Ghost shall come upon thee, \& the power of the most High shall overshadow thee. And therefore also the Holy which shall be born of thee shall be called the Son of God.
And behold thy cousin Elizabeth, she also hath conceived a son in her old age; \& this is the sixth month with her that is called barren: Because no word shall be impossible with God. 38 And Mary said: Behold the handmaid of the Lord; be it done to me according to thy word.]

\newline \textswab{C} \color{red} The following third lesson is to be said on all Mondays of Advent when no feast occurs, except the Vigil of the Nativity, if it should fall on a Monday. \color{black}
\newline \color{red} Sermon of saint August. bishop. Lesson. iij. \color{black}
%Ex Maximus Taurinensis, wikisource
\vspace{-.25em}
\lettrine[lines=2]{\bfseries \color{red} T}{he} holy, desirable, glorious, \& singular solemnity; that is, the Nativity of our Lord \& Savior; beloved brothers, which we are to approach with the utmost devotion, we must prepare for with all our strength, with His help, \& carefully examine all the hidden places of our souls, lest there be any hidden sin in us that might confuse our conscience, wound it, \& offend the eyes of Divine Majesty.
For although Christ our Lord, after His Passion, rose again \& ascended into heaven, He nonetheless considers, as we believe, \& attentively observes how each of His servants prepares \& arranges themselves for celebrating His Nativity, striving to do so without greed, anger, pride, or lust. And according to how He sees each adorned with good morals, so He will dispense to them the grace of His mercy.
For if He sees one clothed in the light of charity, adorned with the pearls of justice or mercy, chaste, humble, merciful, kind, \& sober, He will give that person His Body \& Blood not for judgment, but for remedy, through the ministry of His priests.
But if He sees someone adulterous, drunken, covetous, \& proud, I fear that what the Lord Himself said in the Gospel will be applied to them: ``Friend, how did you come here without a wedding garment?'' And, may the Lord avert it, what follows will happen: ``Bind his hands \& feet, \& cast him into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping \& gnashing of teeth.''
Behold the sentence that one will receive on the Day of Judgment, who approaches the Lord's feast stained with the filth of vices, without the remedy of penance.
For on the Lord's Nativity, beloved brothers, as in a spiritual wedding, Christ is joined with His Bride, the Church. Then Truth arose from the earth, then Justice looked down from heaven, then the Bridegroom proceeded from His chamber, that is, the Word of God proceeded from the virginal womb.
He proceeded with His Bride, the Church; that is, He took on human flesh. Therefore, when invited to these most holy nuptials \& to the feast of the Father, the Son, \& the Holy Spirit, see with what garments we ought to adorn ourselves.
%pp198
And therefore, let us cleanse as much as we can, with the help of God, both our hearts \& our bodies, so that that heavenly Guest may find nothing in us filthy, foul, or obscene, nothing unworthy in His sight.

\newline \textswab{C} \color{red} The following third lesson is to be said on all Tuesdays of Advent when no feast occurs: except the Vigil of the Nativity, if it should fall on a Tuesday. \color{black}
\newline \color{red} From the sermons of saint Aug. bishop. L. iij. \color{black}
\vspace{-.25em}
\lettrine[lines=2]{\bfseries \color{red} H}{ear}, brothers, not my command you hear, but the common command of the Lord.
For thus He said in the Gospel: When you make a dinner or a supper, do not invite the rich, so that they may invite you in return \& you be repaid; but invite the poor \& the crippled, \& you will be blessed, because they have nothing with which to repay you; but you will be repaid at the resurrection of the just.
But someone may say, Then should I not invite friends or relatives to a meal?
Relatives \& neighbors are to be invited, but more sparingly.
And the meals prepared for them should be no less sumptuous \& delightful, yet so frugal, sober, \& decent that there remains something with which the poor may be fed, something may be given to those in need; so that when the day of judgment comes, we may not hear, with the wicked who now despise the poor: Depart from me, accursed, into everlasting fire, but with the just \& merciful we may merit to hear: Come, blessed of my Father, receive the kingdom; for I was hungry \& you gave me to eat, thirsty \& you gave me to drink. At the same time may that desirable voice also be directed to us: Well done, good \& faithful servant; because you have been faithful over little, I will set you over much; enter into the joy of your Lord.
But so that these things, which we have suggested, may cling more firmly to the senses of your charity, we briefly repeat what has been said.
For we admonish you, brothers, that since the Nativity of the Lord is near, we prepare ourselves as for a nuptial \& heavenly feast, adorned with good works \& free from all luxury, giving alms to the poor, \& casting out from our hearts wrath, hatred, \& venom.
Faithfully preserve chastity, more often recall the poor to your meals, rise earlier for vigils, standing in church either pray or sing psalms; do not utter idle or obscene words, \& correct those who wish to do so.
Keep peace with all, \& recall those whom you find discordant to concord.
If you faithfully wish to carry out these things with Christ assisting you, you will be able in this life to approach the Lord's altar with a clear conscience, \& in the future to reach eternal blessedness happily, through our Lord Jesus Christ, who lives \& reigns forever \& ever. Amen.

\newline \textswab{C} \color{red} The following third lesson is to be said on all Wednesdays of Advent when no feast occurs: except the Vigil of the Nativity, if it should fall on a Wednesday. \color{black}
\newline \color{red} Sermon of saint Aug. bishop. Lesson. iij. \color{black}
\vspace{-.25em}
\lettrine[lines=2]{\bfseries \color{red} A}{s} the most sacred solemnity approaches, in which our Savior mercifully willed to be born among men, beloved brothers, consider carefully how we ought to prepare in Advent for such great power, so that we may merit to receive our King \& Lord with joy \& gladness, with glory \& praises, \&, in His presence, rejoice with exultation among the blessed assemblies of the saints, rather than, on account of our filth, be rejected by Him among sinners \& deserve eternal confusion.
And therefore I exhort \& admonish you, that as much as we can, with the help of God, we labor so that on that day we may be able to approach the Lord's altar with sincere \& pure conscience, a clean heart, \& a chaste body, \& may merit to receive His Body \& Blood not for judgment, but for the remedy of our soul.
For our life consists in the Body of Christ, as He Himself said: ``Unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man \& drink His blood, you will have no life in you.''
Let him therefore change his life who wishes to receive life.
For if he does not change his life, he will receive life unto judgment, \& will be more corrupted than healed; more killed than vivified.
For thus the Apostle said: ``Whoever eats the Body of the Lord \& drinks His Blood unworthily, eats \& drinks judgment to himself.''
%pp203
And although we ought always to be adorned \& splendid in good works, especially on the day of the Lord's Nativity, as He Himself said in the Gospel, ``Let your works shine before men,'' consider, I pray, brothers, how when a powerful or noble man desires to celebrate his own birthday or that of his son, with what diligence, many days beforehand, he arranges that everything in his house that is filthy is cleaned, that whatever is inept or inappropriate is thrown out, \& that whatever is useful \& necessary is provided.
Even if the house is dark, it is whitewashed; the floors are swept; it is adorned with various flowers. Everything pertaining to the delight of soul \& body is provided for with care.
What is all this, beloved brothers, except that the birthday may be celebrated with joy for the one who is dying?
If then so much is prepared for your own or your son's birthday, how much \& what kind of preparation ought you make for the Nativity of your Lord?
If such things you prepare for a mortal, what ought you to prepare for the eternal?
Therefore, whatever you would not wish to find in your house, labor as much as you can that God may not find in your soul.
